quotes: She took office on 1 March 2021, becoming the first woman and the first African to serve as Director-General.
Dr Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala took office as WTO Director-General on 1 March 2021.
Her term of office will expire on 31 August 2025.
On 29 November 2024, Dr Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala was reappointed as Director-General for a second four-year term, set to begin on 1 September 2025.
On 29 November 2024, Dr Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala was reappointed as Director-General for a second four-year term, set to begin on 1 September 2025.
Previously, Dr Okonjo-Iweala twice served as Nigeria's Finance Minister (2003-2006 and 2011-2015).
Previously, Dr Okonjo-Iweala twice served as Nigeria's Finance Minister (2003-2006 and 2011-2015) and briefly acted as Foreign Minister in 2006, the first woman to hold both positions.

roles.title: Finance Minister
quotes: Previously, Dr Okonjo-Iweala twice served as Nigeria's Finance Minister (2003-2006 and 2011-2015).
As a development economist and Finance Minister, Dr Okonjo-Iweala steered her country through various reforms ranging from macroeconomic to trade, financial and real sector issues.

roles.title: development economist
quotes: She had a 25-year career at the World Bank as a development economist, rising to the No. 2 position of Managing Director, Operations.
As a development economist and Finance Minister, Dr Okonjo-Iweala steered her country through various reforms ranging from macroeconomic to trade, financial and real sector issues.
She is a global finance expert, an economist and international development professional with over 40 years of experience working in Asia, Africa, Europe, Latin America and North America.
